sub_topic: Finding the area of a parallelogram.
message_1: A parallelogram has a base of 12 meters and a height of 8 meters. What is the area of the parallelogram?
message_2:
The area of a parallelogram can be calculated using the formula: Area = base × height.

In this case, the base is 12 meters and the height is 8 meters. So, the area of the parallelogram is:

Area = 12 meters × 8 meters = 96 square meters.
